item.title: ||xuobbeten and the lion
item.summary: ||xuobbeten is carried away by the lion while she sleeps. It bites her head and kills her. It puts her in its mouth and carries her down to the water. The people name the water '||xuobbeten' because it has no bushes.
item.comments: 1) p.7217v: |han≠kass'o heard this story from his father-in-law (||kabbo), 2) p.7219v: see The !kwana thorn tree, 3) See p.7215v for further details about ||xuobbeten, 4) This story is found in Book VIII-14
